unnormalised: Mumbai, Oct 26th: The Indian Rupee (₹) exhibited moderate volatility today in Forex markets amidst fluctuating global cues. Opening at ₹83.20 against the USD, the INR witnessed intraday swings, touching a high of ₹83.15 and a low of ₹83.35. Experts attribute this to mixed signals from US bond yields and ongoing geopolitical concerns. Investment analysts advise caution for short-term trades.
normalised: Mumbai, October twenty sixth: The Indian Rupee (rupee) exhibited moderate volatility today in Forex markets amidst fluctuating global cues. Opening at rupee eighty three point two zero against the U-S-D, the I-N-R witnessed intraday swings, touching a high of rupee eighty three point one five and a low of rupee eighty three point three five. Experts attribute this to mixed signals from U-S bond yields and ongoing geopolitical concerns. Investment analysts advise caution for short-term trades.

unnormalised: Equity markets, on the other hand, displayed a bullish trend. The BSE Sensex surged by 350 points, closing at 66,500. Nifty50 also experienced gains, settling at 19,850. Major gainers included Reliance Industries (up by 2%) and HDFC Bank (up by 1.5%). Foreign Institutional Investors (FIIs) injected approximately ₹1,500 crore into the Indian equity market, fueling the rally.
normalised: Equity markets, on the other hand, displayed a bullish trend. The B-S-E Sensex surged by three hundred and fifty points, closing at sixty six thousand five hundred. Nifty fifty also experienced gains, settling at nineteen thousand eight hundred and fifty. Major gainers included Reliance Industries (up by two percent) and H-D-F-C Bank (up by one point five percent). Foreign Institutional Investors (F-I-I-s) injected approximately rupee one thousand five hundred crore into the Indian equity market, fueling the rally.

unnormalised: Market participants are keenly awaiting the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) monetary policy announcement scheduled for Nov 3rd. Analysts anticipate a status quo on interest rates, but are closely monitoring the central bank's commentary on inflation and economic growth. Gold prices remained stable at Rs. 60,000 per 10 grams.
normalised: Market participants are keenly awaiting the Reserve Bank of India's (R-B-I) monetary policy announcement scheduled for November third. Analysts anticipate a status quo on interest rates, but are closely monitoring the central bank's commentary on inflation and economic growth. Gold prices remained stable at rupee sixty thousand per ten grams.
